intro: Dysoxylum alliaceum var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dysoxylum, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
